pli-tv-bu-vb-sk21:0.4.eng: The subchapter on hands on hips

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk21:0.5.eng: 21. The training rule on hands on hips

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk21:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk21:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk21:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū khambhakatā antaraghare gacchanti …pe….
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk21:1.2.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six had their hands on their hips while walking in inhabited areas. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk21:1.3.1.eng: “‘I will not have my hands on my hips while walking in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk21:1.4.eng: One should not have one’s hands on one’s hips while walking in an inhabited area.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk21:1.5.pli: Yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca ekato vā ubhato vā khambhaṃ katvā antaraghare gacchati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk21:1.5.eng: If a monk, out of disrespect, has one or both hands on his hips while walking in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk21:1.8.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk21:1.9.eng: The first training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:0.4.eng: The subchapter on hands on hips

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:0.5.eng: 22. The second training rule on hands on hips

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū khambhakatā antaraghare nisīdanti …pe….
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:1.2.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six had their hands on their hips while sitting in inhabited areas. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:1.3.1.eng: “‘I will not have my hands on my hips while sitting in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:1.4.eng: One should not have one’s hands on one’s hips while sitting in an inhabited area.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:1.5.pli: Yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca ekato vā ubhato vā khambhaṃ katvā antaraghare nisīdati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:1.5.eng: If a monk, out of disrespect, has one or both hands on his hips while sitting in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:1.11.eng: if he has entered his dwelling;

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:1.14.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:1.15.eng: The second training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk23:0.4.eng: The subchapter on hands on hips

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk23:0.5.eng: 23. The training rule on covering the head

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk23:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk23:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk23:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū sasīsaṃ pārupitvā antaraghare gacchanti …pe….
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk23:1.2.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six were covering their heads with their upper robes while walking in inhabited areas. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk23:1.3.1.eng: “‘I will not cover my head while walking in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk23:1.4.eng: One should not cover one’s head while walking in an inhabited area.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk23:1.5.pli: Yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca sasīsaṃ pārupitvā antaraghare gacchati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk23:1.5.eng: If a monk, out of disrespect, covers his head with his upper robe while walking in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk23:1.8.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk23:1.9.eng: The third training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk24:0.4.eng: The subchapter on hands on hips

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk24:0.5.eng: 24. The second training rule on covering the head

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk24:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk24:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk24:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū sasīsaṃ pārupitvā antaraghare nisīdanti …pe….
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk24:1.2.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six were covering their heads with their robes while sitting in inhabited areas. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk24:1.3.1.eng: “‘I will not cover my head while sitting in inhabited areas;’ this is how you should train.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk24:1.4.eng: One should not cover one’s head while sitting in an inhabited area.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk24:1.5.pli: Yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca sasīsaṃ pārupitvā antaraghare nisīdati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk24:1.5.eng: If a monk, out of disrespect, covers his head with his upper robe while sitting in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk24:1.11.eng: if he has entered his dwelling;

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk24:1.14.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk24:1.15.eng: The fourth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk25:0.4.eng: The subchapter on hands on hips

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk25:0.5.eng: 25. The training rule on squatting on the heels

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk25:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk25:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk25:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū ukkuṭikāya antaraghare gacchanti …pe….
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk25:1.2.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six were moving about while squatting on their heels in inhabited areas. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk25:1.3.1.eng: “‘I will not move about while squatting on my heels in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk25:1.3.1.comm: As at Bu Sk 15:1.3.1, it seems that gacchati, which normally means “to go”, here refers to any posture more upright than outright sitting down. Moreover, it seems to refer to any sort of movement from one place to another, however minor.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk25:1.4.eng: One should not move about while squatting on one’s heels in an inhabited area.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk25:1.5.pli: Yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca ukkuṭikāya antaraghare gacchati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk25:1.5.eng: If a monk, out of disrespect, moves about while squatting on his heels in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk25:1.8.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk25:1.9.eng: The fifth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk26:0.4.eng: The subchapter on hands on hips

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk26:0.5.eng: 26. The training rule on sitting with clasped knees

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk26:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk26:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk26:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū pallatthikāya antaraghare nisīdanti …pe….
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk26:1.2.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six were clasping their knees while sitting in inhabited areas. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk26:1.3.1.eng: “‘I will not clasp my knees while sitting in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk26:1.4.eng: One should not clasp one’s knees while sitting in an inhabited area.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk26:1.5.pli: Yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca hatthapallatthikāya vā dussapallatthikāya vā antaraghare nisīdati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk26:1.5.eng: If a monk, out of disrespect, clasps his knees with his hands or with a cloth while sitting in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk26:1.11.eng: if he has entered his dwelling;

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk26:1.14.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk26:1.15.eng: The sixth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk27:0.4.eng: The subchapter on hands on hips

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk27:0.5.eng: 27. The training rule on receiving respectfully

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk27:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk27:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk27:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū asakkaccaṃ piṇḍapātaṃ paṭiggaṇhanti chaḍḍetukāmā viya …pe….
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk27:1.2.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six were receiving almsfood contemptuously, as if wanting to throw it away. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk27:1.3.1.eng: “‘I will receive almsfood respectfully,’ this is how you should train.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk27:1.4.eng: Almsfood is to be received respectfully.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk27:1.5.pli: Yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca asakkaccaṃ piṇḍapātaṃ paṭiggaṇhāti chaḍḍetukāmo viya, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk27:1.5.eng: If a monk, out of disrespect, receives almsfood contemptuously, as if wanting to throw it away, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk27:1.8.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk27:1.9.eng: The seventh training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk28:0.4.eng: The subchapter on hands on hips

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk28:0.5.eng: 28. The training rule on receiving with attention on the almsbowl

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk28:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk28:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk28:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū tahaṃ tahaṃ olokentā piṇḍapātaṃ paṭiggaṇhanti, ākirantepi atikkantepi na jānanti …pe….
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk28:1.2.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six were receiving almsfood while looking here and there, and they did not know whether people were still giving or whether they had received too much. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk28:1.3.1.eng: “‘I will receive almsfood with attention on the almsbowl,’ this is how you should train.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk28:1.4.eng: Almsfood is to be received with attention on the bowl.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk28:1.5.pli: Yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca tahaṃ tahaṃ olokento piṇḍapātaṃ paṭiggaṇhāti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk28:1.5.eng: If a monk, out of disrespect, receives almsfood while looking here and there, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk28:1.8.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk28:1.9.eng: The eighth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:0.4.eng: The subchapter on hands on hips

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:0.5.eng: 29. The training rule on receiving the right proportion of bean curry

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū piṇḍapātaṃ paṭiggaṇhantā sūpaññeva bahuṃ paṭiggaṇhanti …pe….
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:1.2.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six were receiving almsfood with large amounts of bean curry. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:1.3.1.eng: “‘I will receive almsfood with the right proportion of bean curry,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:1.3.1.comm: According to Sp 2.604 this means the bean curries should make up one quarter of the rice: Samasūpako nāma yattha bhattassa catutthabhāgappamāṇo sūpo hoti, “Wherever the bean curry is one quarter of the rice is called samasūpaka.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:1.5.eng: there are two kinds of bean curry, to be taken with the hand: mung-bean curry and black-gram curry.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:1.5.comm: The punctuation of MS has been corrected here so as to agree with Bu Sk 34:1.6. The text mistakenly had hatthahāriyo in the next sentence.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:1.6.eng: Almsfood should be received with the right proportion of bean curry.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:1.7.pli: Yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca sūpaññeva bahuṃ paṭiggaṇhāti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:1.7.eng: If a monk, out of disrespect, receives much bean curry, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:1.13.eng: if it is any food apart from bean curry;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:1.13.comm: According to Kkh this means any curries apart from bean curry: Ṭhapetvā pana sūpaṁ avasesā sabbā pi sūpeyyabyañjanavikati rasaraso nāma hoti, “But apart from bean curry, all kinds of curry are called rasarasa.” My translation, however, is based on the fact that all other foods too are excluded.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:1.15.eng: if it is from those who have given an invitation;

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:1.16.eng: if it is for the benefit of someone else;

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:1.17.eng: if it is by means of his own property;

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:1.20.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:1.21.eng: The ninth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk3:0.4.eng: The subchapter on evenly all around

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk3:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk3:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk3:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū kāyaṃ vivaritvā antaraghare gacchanti …pe….
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk3:1.2.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six did not cover their bodies while walking in inhabited areas. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk3:1.3.1.eng: “‘I will be well-covered while walking in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk3:1.4.eng: One should be well-covered while walking in an inhabited area.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk3:1.5.pli: Yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca kāyaṃ vivaritvā antaraghare gacchati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk3:1.5.eng: If a monk, out of disrespect, does not cover his body while walking in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk3:1.5.comm: Sp 2.578: Kāyaṁ vivaritvāti jattumpi urampi vivaritvā, “Does not cover his body means shoulder or chest uncovered.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk3:1.13.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk3:1.14.eng: The third training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk30:0.4.eng: The subchapter on hands on hips

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk30:0.5.eng: 30. The training rule on even levels

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk30:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk30:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk30:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū thūpīkataṃ piṇḍapātaṃ paṭiggaṇhanti …pe….
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk30:1.2.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six received almsfood in a heap. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk30:1.3.1.eng: “‘I will receive an even level of almsfood,’ this is how you should train.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk30:1.4.eng: Almsfood is to be received at an even level.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk30:1.5.pli: Yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca thūpīkataṃ piṇḍapātaṃ paṭiggaṇhāti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk30:1.5.eng: If a monk, out of disrespect, receives almsfood in a heap, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk30:1.9.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk30:1.10.eng: The tenth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk30:1.11.eng: The third subchapter on hands on hips is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk31:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk31:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk31:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū asakkaccaṃ piṇḍapātaṃ bhuñjanti abhuñjitukāmā viya …pe….
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk31:1.2.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six were eating almsfood contemptuously, as if not wanting to eat it. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk31:1.3.1.eng: “‘I will eat almsfood respectfully,’ this is how you should train.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk31:1.4.eng: Almsfood is to be eaten respectfully.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk31:1.5.pli: Yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca asakkaccaṃ piṇḍapātaṃ bhuñjati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk31:1.5.eng: If a monk, out of disrespect, eats almsfood contemptuously, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk31:1.13.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk31:1.14.eng: The first training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk32:0.5.eng: 32. The training rule on attention on the almsbowl

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk32:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk32:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk32:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū tahaṃ tahaṃ olokentā piṇḍapātaṃ bhuñjanti, ākirantepi atikkantepi na jānanti …pe….
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk32:1.2.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six were eating almsfood while looking here and there, and they did not know whether people were still giving or whether they had received too much. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk32:1.3.1.eng: “‘I will eat almsfood with attention on the almsbowl,’ this is how you should train.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk32:1.4.eng: Almsfood is to be eaten with attention on the bowl.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk32:1.5.pli: Yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca tahaṃ tahaṃ olokento piṇḍapātaṃ bhuñjati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk32:1.5.eng: If a monk, out of disrespect, eats almsfood while looking here and there, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk32:1.8.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk32:1.9.eng: The second training rule is finished.
